title: Restore 'Good Choice' meme reveal on Yes click

requirements.text: Update the post-"Yes" (answered) view so that it shows a single meme image with the text "Good Choice" (instead of showing the Bible verse image and the "Marry me" image).

quotes: when she clicks yes , show her a meme image telling her " Good Choice"

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Yes" button transitions the UI to an answered state.
The answered state renders exactly one image: the "Good Choice" meme.
The answered state no longer renders the two images currently shown (Bible verse and "Marry me").
All user-facing text remains in English.

requirements.text: Add the "Good Choice" meme image as a static frontend asset under the generated assets path and render it directly from the frontend (no backend involvement).

quotes: show her a meme image telling her " Good Choice"

acceptanceCriteria: A single image file for the "Good Choice" meme exists under the frontend public generated assets directory.
The answered state references the static asset via an absolute public path (e.g., "/assets/generated/...png").
No backend code is added or used to serve the image.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; do not add backend logic for this change.
Store and serve images as static frontend assets; do not route images through the backend.
nonGoals: Do not add authentication or Internet Identity flows.
Do not add additional choices beyond "Yes" and "No".
Do not add new pages, routing, or multi-step flows beyond the existing single-screen interaction and the answered reveal.

required: Meme-style image with bold, high-contrast caption text that reads "Good Choice" on a romantic/pink-friendly palette (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
